basics.summary: New Researcher in Scientific Community | Hands-on Enthusiast | Robotics Dev | AIGC Lover | Amateur Photographer

work.name: School of Artificial Intelligence, Southeast University
work.summary: I am now working in the Key Laboratory of New Generation Artificial Intelligence Technology&Its Interdisciplinary Applications and Jiangsu Provincial Key Laboratory of Network and Information Security, under the supervise of Professor Hao Chen and Professor Ruiting Zhou.

work.name: 3SE Robot Team, Southeast University
work.summary: I am now leading the R&D of my school's Robot Team. (Mainly on vision tasks üëÅ).

volunteer.organization: Southeast University Education Foundation, Rongjiang No. 1 Middle School
volunteer.summary: I volunteered to teach in remote and underdeveloped areas during the summer vacation, aiming to spread the knowledge and ideas to a wider region, providing support for the rural revitalization strategy with the energy of young talents.
highlights: Nominated for the Top Ten Social Practice Awards at Southeast University.
Xinhuanet and other authoritative media have reported on this, with over 56,000 total views.

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter K√∂rper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson‚ÄìMorley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: √úber einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
